text.comment:
Description:

Escapes HTML special characters to prevent XSS attacks and ensure safe text display

Returns:

The escaped string with HTML entities, or original if null/undefined

Example:
// Basic XSS prevention
const userInput = '<script>alert("XSS")</script>';
const safeText = escapeHTML(userInput);
console.log(safeText); // '<script>alert("XSS")</script>'
Example:

// Safe display of user content const commentText = escapeHTML(user.comment); document.getElementById('comment').innerHTML = <p>${commentText}</p>;

Example:
// Real-time input sanitization
const inputBox = document.getElementById('input-box');
const outputBox = document.getElementById('output-box');

inputBox.addEventListener('input', () => {
  const escapedText = escapeHTML(inputBox.value);
  outputBox.textContent = escapedText; // Use textContent for additional safety
});
Example:

// Escape quotes for HTML attributes const title = User said: "Hello & goodbye"; const escapedTitle = escapeHTML(title); element.setAttribute('title', escapedTitle);
